}}{{TIDTOC|adapter}} ==Overview== The FCC label indicates the OUI is 70:B3:D5. It isn't confirmed.
Amazon notes the manufacturer as '''InnoDisk Corporation'''.
{{seealso|List of 802.11ad Hardware}}
===Specifications=== *Wi-Fi 802.11ad compliance (WiGig) *Frequency Range: 60 GHz (57-71 GHz) *Operation Frequency: CH 1/2/3 (CH2) :*Channel 1: 58.32 GHz :*Channel 2: 60.48 GHz :*Channel 3: 62.64 GHz *Single carrier, 2.25Gbps Throughput *Adaptive 360 degree Beamforming *WPA2 Personal Wireless Encryption *Internal storage - 8GB ([https://www.innodisk.com/en/products ''InnoDisk'']) *Interface: USB 3.0 Type A port
==Links of Interest== [https://perasotech.com/w-series-products/ More information on the Peraso chipset used ('W120')]
===News=== *[https://www.cnx-software.com/2018/12/29/millitronic-mg360-802-11ad-usb-adapter/ ''Millitronic MG360 WiGig 802.11ad USB Adapter'' on '''CNX-Software'''] *[https://www.seeedstudio.com/Millitronic-MG360-WiGig-IEEE802-11ad-60GHz-USB3-0-Adapter-Dongle-match-R9000-XR700.html ''Millitronic MG360 802.11ad 60GHz USB 3.0 Adapter'' on '''SeeedStudio''']
